messageValues.message: You are an AI operation classifier for git tasks. Analyze the user's request and determine which git operation they want to perform.|Available operations:1. **CODE_REVIEW** - ANY request that mentions pull requests, PRs, merge requests, MRs, code changes, diffs, or code review. This includes checking if PRs exist, listing PRs, viewing PRs, or reviewing code.2. **UPDATE_REPOS** - Requests to update, pull, fetch, sync, rebase, or merge branches in repositories.Analyze the user request: '{{ $json.chatInput || $json.query }}'Git instructions: '{{ $json.gitInstructions || 'None provided' }}'CRITICAL RULES:- If the request mentions "pull request", "PR", "merge request", or "MR" in ANY context → CODE_REVIEW- If the request asks to "check", "list", "show", "view", or "see" PRs/code → CODE_REVIEW- If the request asks to "review", "examine", or "analyze" code → CODE_REVIEWExamples:- 'Check if any pull requests are available' → CODE_REVIEW- 'Are there any PRs?' → CODE_REVIEW- 'Check for open pull requests' → CODE_REVIEW- 'List all PRs in the repository' → CODE_REVIEW- 'Show me open pull requests' → CODE_REVIEW- 'Review my PR #42' → CODE_REVIEW- 'Do a code review on feature/login' → CODE_REVIEW- 'Check the diff and leave feedback' → CODE_REVIEW- 'Pull the latest changes in all repos' → UPDATE_REPOS- 'Sync my fork with upstream main' → UPDATE_REPOS- 'Fetch & rebase my feature branch onto develop' → UPDATE_REPOS- 'Update dependencies across repos' → UPDATE_REPOSIMPORTANT: Respond with ONLY the operation name in JSON format:{"operation": "CODE_REVIEW"} or {"operation": "UPDATE_REPOS"}When in doubt about PRs or code changes, ALWAYS choose CODE_REVIEW.

nodes.name: Create target Prompt from PR Diffs

parameters.text:
You are a code reviewer. 

STEPS:
1. Call 'getInputData' tool to get the actual file changes to review
2. Call 'codeBestPractices' tool to get review guidelines
3. Review each file in the data from step 1

Look for lines starting with "### File:" in the input data, extract exact filenames, and review the diff content.

Format:
### File: [exact filename from input]
[review] OR LGTM

Summary: Reviewed X files.

parameters.content: Fetches open pull requests from Tardigrade repository using GitHub API with authentication.
Checks if any pull requests exist in Tardigrade repository before proceeding with processing.
Processes multiple Tardigrade PRs and creates metadata for file fetching including PR numbers & URLs.
Fetches detailed file changes and diffs from each of the pull request using GitHub Files API.
Creates formatted prompt with PR diffs, groups files by PR, preparing data for AI code review.
Code Review Open AI agent that performs comprehensive code review using GPT-4, analyzes differences, and provides feedback.
Exports the AI code review results as a text file for external viewing and record keeping.

parameters.name: codeBestPractices
parameters.description: Provides comprehensive code best practices and guidelines for code review. Use this tool to get coding standards, security practices, performance guidelines, and language-specific recommendations.

parameters.name: getInputData
parameters.description: Gets the actual file changes to review from the workflow input

parameters.content: Notification about automated git code PR reviews will be sent to configured email address

parameters.jsCode:
// Create PowerShell script to check git status and output JSON
// Repository configurations
const inputData = [
  { name: 'Agent Flows', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Work/Key/AgentWorklfows'},
  { name: 'Tardigrade', path: 'C:/Repo/Tardigrade' },
  { name: 'Tardigrade Data', path: 'C:/Users/Jomiru Sergiu/Documents/Terminal' },
  { name: 'JP-Tardigrade-api', path: 'C:/Repo/JP-Tardigrade-api' },
  { name: 'JP-AI', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-AI' },
  { name: 'JP-Tardigrade', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-Tardigrade' },
  { name: 'JP-Tardigrade-Data', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-Tardigrade-Data' },
  { name: 'JP-Tardigrade-test-actions', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-Tardigrade-test-actions' },
  { name: 'JP-Tardigrade-UPK284', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-Tardigrade-UPK284' },
  { name: 'JP-UMA-License', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-UMA-License' },
  { name: 'JP-UMA-X-Doc', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-UMAX-Doc' },
  { name: 'JP-MAX-Toolbox', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-MAX-Toolbox' },
  { name: 'JP-Template_NetCore_Stk', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-Template_NetCore_Stk' },
  { name: 'JP-umalib', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-umalib' },
  { name: 'JP-umaLib-old', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-umaLib-old' },
  { name: 'JP-UMATraining', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-UMATraining' },
  { name: 'JP-vite-cesium-ion', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-vite-cesium-ion' },
  { name: 'JP-Walrus', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-Walrus' },
  { name: 'JP-SensorCalibrationTool', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-SensorCalibrationTool' },
  { name: 'JP-SEGPythonAPI', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-SEGPythonAPI' },
  { name: 'JP-SatelliteMissionScenarioDesigner', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-SatelliteMissionScenarioDesigner' },
  { name: 'JP-PENGUIN', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-PENGUIN' },
  { name: 'JP-ORCA-Validation', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-ORCA-Validation' },
  { name: 'JP-ORCA', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-ORCA' },
  { name: 'JP-ODTKPythonAPI', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-ODTKPythonAPI' },
  { name: 'JP-MolaMola', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-MolaMola' },
  { name: 'JP-JFD_FileConverter', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-JFD_FileConverter' },
  { name: 'JP-JFD-demo', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-JFD-demo' },
  { name: 'JP-JAXA-FCS', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-JAXA-FCS' },
  { name: 'JP-EOISTJpC', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-EOISTJpC' },
  { name: 'JP-Dragonfly', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-Dragonfly' },
  { name: 'JP-AutoMP-QualityAssurance', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/JP-AutoMP-QualityAssurance' },
  { name: 'US-votw', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/US-votw' },
  { name: 'US-tardis', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/US-tardis' },
  { name: 'US-general', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/US-general' },
  { name: 'US-hail-mary', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/US-hail-mary' },
  { name: 'US-hott', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/US-hott' },
  { name: 'US-ishimura', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/US-ishimura' },
  { name: 'US-JCO', path: 'C:/Dev/LSAS Tec Dropbox/Jomiru Sergiu/Backup/US-JCO' }
].map(repo => ({ json: repo }));

// Build simpler PowerShell command without here-string issues
const repos = inputData.map(item => {
  const name = item.json.name.replace(/'/g, "''");
  const path = item.json.path.replace(/'/g, "''");
  return `@{Name='${name}'; Path='${path}'}`;
}).join(',');

// Create a direct PowerShell command without file creation
const command = `powershell -Command "` +
  `$ErrorActionPreference='SilentlyContinue'; ` +
  `$results = @{timestamp=(Get-Date).ToString('yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffZ'); repositories=@{}}; ` +
  `$repos = @(${repos}); ` +
  `foreach ($repo in $repos) { ` +
    `try { ` +
      `git config --global --add safe.directory $repo.Path 2>$null; ` +
      `Set-Location $repo.Path; ` +
      `if (Test-Path '.git') { ` +
        `$current = git rev-parse HEAD 2>$null; ` +
        `git fetch origin --quiet 2>$null; ` +
        `$remote = git rev-parse origin/main 2>$null; ` +
        `$behind = if ($current -and $remote) { (git rev-list HEAD..origin/main --count 2>$null) } else { 0 }; ` +
        `$ahead = if ($current -and $remote) { (git rev-list origin/main..HEAD --count 2>$null) } else { 0 }; ` +
        `$lastCommit = git log -1 --format='%H %s' 2>$null; ` +
        `$status = if ($behind -gt 0) { 'BEHIND' } elseif ($ahead -gt 0) { 'AHEAD' } else { 'UP_TO_DATE' }; ` +
        `$results.repositories[$repo.Name] = @{path=$repo.Path; status=$status; behind=[int]$behind; ahead=[int]$ahead; lastCommit=$lastCommit; error=$null}; ` +
      `} else { ` +
        `$results.repositories[$repo.Name] = @{path=$repo.Path; status='NOT_A_REPO'; behind=0; ahead=0; lastCommit=$null; error='Directory is not a git repository'}; ` +
      `} ` +
    `} catch { ` +
      `$results.repositories[$repo.Name] = @{path=$repo.Path; status='ERROR'; behind=0; ahead=0; lastCommit=$null; error=$_.Exception.Message}; ` +
    `} ` +
  `}; ` +
  `$results.summary = @{totalRepos=$results.repositories.Count; upToDate=($results.repositories.Values | Where-Object { $_.status -eq 'UP_TO_DATE' }).Count; behind=($results.repositories.Values | Where-Object { $_.status -eq 'BEHIND' }).Count; ahead=($results.repositories.Values | Where-Object { $_.status -eq 'AHEAD' }).Count; errors=($results.repositories.Values | Where-Object { $_.status -eq 'ERROR' -or $_.status -eq 'NOT_A_REPO' }).Count}; ` +
  `$results | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 4` +
`"`;

return [{
  json: {
    totalRepos: inputData.length,
    batchCommand: command,
    repoList: inputData.map(item => ({ name: item.json.name, path: item.json.path }))
  }
}];

parameters.content: Hourly trigger that auto checks repo status for updates every 60 minutes and pulls data.
Configures list of 35+ repositories to monitor, including Tardigrade, JP and US projects paths.
Executes .ps1 command for git status across all repositories using batch processing.
Parses JSON from PowerShell git status check and splits repos, that need updates.
Filters repositories and identifies which ones need updates based on behind status.
Routes data flow pull commands for repos needing updates or sends summary.
Conditional that checks if repos pull commands are ready for execution.
Executes git pull commands for repositories that are behind their remotes.
Generate summary with repo status, success/failure counts, and logs.
Exports the final log content as a text file for external viewing and analysis.
Filters repos by status depending if data update is necessary or not and sends
Routes repos requiring PRs or generates a summary for no updates needed
Auto triggers git repo monitoring when n8n starts up or workflow is activated.
Notification about automated git update pull will be sent to configured email address
Trigger from other flows to perform checks or processing of git requests

main.node: Create target Prompt from PR Diffs
